title-group.article-title: ON THE MINIMUM PROPERTY OF THE PSEUDO x-CONDITION NUMBER FOR A LINEAR OPERATOR

abstract.p: It is well known that the x-condition number of a linear operator is a measure of ill condition with respect to its generalized inverses and a relative error bound with respect to the generalized inverses of operator T with a small perturbation operator E, namely, $\frac{{\left\| {\left( {T + E} \right) + - T + } \right\|}} {{\left\| {{T^ + }} \right\|}} \leqslant \frac{{x\left( T \right)\frac{{\left\| E \right\|}}{{\left\| T \right\|}}}}{{1 - x\left( T \right)\frac{{\left\| E \right\|}}{T}}},$] where x(T) = ∥T∥·∥T⁺∥. The problem is whether there exists a positive number µ(T) independent of B but dependent on T such that the above relative error bound holds and µ(T) < x(T). In this paper, an answer is given to this problem. The main result is Theorem. Let Z, Y be two Banach spaces, T, E ∊ B[X, Y] and ∥E∥·∥T⁺∥ < 1. Suppose $\frac{{\left\| {\left( {T + E} \right) + - {T^ + }} \right\|}}{{\left\| {{T^ + }} \right\|}} \leqslant \mu \left( T \right)\frac{{\left\| E \right\|}}{{\left\| T \right\|}}.$ Then x(T)≼µ(T), where µ(T) is a positive number independent of E but dependent on T and (IY+ET⁺)⁻¹(T+E) maps N(T) into R(T). This theorem shorn that x(T) is minimum in the above sence.
